creator: andy@mediasurface.com
text:
Using TomCat 3.2.2 on Solaris 8, calling pageContext.setAttribute with an 
invalid scope should cause an IllegalStateException to be thrown, but it isn't.

Code to reproduce:

<%
pageContext.setAttribute("tester", "success?", 0); // IllegalStateException 
never thrown
out.println(pageContext.findAttribute("tester")); // Doesn't return value 
because previous line used invalid scope
%>

Workaround: Use one of PageContext.PAGE_SCOPE .. PageContext.APPLICATION_SCOPE 
as the value of the scope parameter.

Garbage in... We can't detect all the possible error conditions, there are
countless ways you can do something wrong. Adding a check on each setAttribute
is also overkill. Maybe in a future version.

text:
The Javadoc says that setAttribute(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object o, 
int scope) will throw a java.lang.IllegalArgumentException if the scope is 
invalid. Sorry, I should have pointed this out originally.

Ops, you're right, thank you very much. I'll commit a fix  tonight ( against 
3.3).
